column1: full outside off to start, no swing, driven hard to mid-off. Not great timing.
creamed. Swing for Shami, overpitched and wide outside off. Finch strides forward and nails his square drive through point.
full delivery outside off, seaming back in, left alone
there are signs already of low bounce. Short and wide outside off, Finch cuts, his under-edge goes towards Dhoni who can't stop the ball cleanly. Bounced awkwardly in front of him too.
tight line, around middle and leg, defended into the leg side
short and wide, a touch of width, chopped into the cover region. Not going to be easy to execute cross-batted strokes with variable bounce
nice start from Umesh, full and wide outside off, plenty of away shape. 133 kph, lands well short of Dhoni. Not good signs these
carries at ankle height this time. Full and wide outside off, left alone. Just a hint of away shape
races away down to fine leg. Nothing wrong with this outfield. On the pads. and Finch flicks away down to fine leg. Shami races to his right to save two. Good running too
a thick outside edge down to third man. Full outside off, Finch plays the line. Umesh gets some away movement
ooh, sloppy from Kohli. Good length outside off, punched towards Kohli at cover who gets to his left but fumbles, allowing a run
full and straight, skewed to midwicket with a closed bat face

beautiful. Just a straight bat and put away. That is the right length for the overhead conditions but the wrong length for this pitch. Full outside off, checking if there is swing. Hardly any, and Warner can drive through mid-off
on the pads this time, adjusts his length, but the line isn't great. Clipped through square leg.
fullish length around middle, the perfect length, Warner doesn't know whether to come forward or go back. A thick inside edge hits his pad
fullish outside off, defended into the cover region
full on off, Warner runs at the bowler and clips him away to mid-on. Trying to put Shami off his length.

a thick outside edge and no catching up with that on this outfield. Full and wide, Warner plays the line, but some angle takes the ball away, taking the edge. Wide of gully and too fine for a square third man.
ooh, that's tripe. Short and wide, swinging away. Finch wants to hammer through the line, without feet movement, chopped back up the pitch
that's a lot, lot better. Just timed away. Short and wide, Finch watches the ball onto his bat, transfers his weight into the ball and punches his push through extra cover
adjusts his line straightaway. Straighter and fullish, worked into the leg side
poor delivery. India's new ball bowlers looking very rusty. A slower delivery on the pads, flicked through square leg for four. Focussed on timing, not power.
drifts down leg this time, wide. 137 kph, Umesh struggling. Bowling two lengths and two lines
good length on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
another awful delivery. Short and very wide, Finch can't connect cleanly with his cut, the ball trickles towards mid-off
full outside off, Finch drives hard into the ground towards cover
full and straight, pushed to mid-on. Finch wants one, but quick singles are not easy here because of the pace of the outfield.
excellent from Shami, much much better. Fuller than a good length is the perfect length to most batsmen, Finch in particular who likes to stay back. Defended back
width. Not a lot, which means Finch can only go at it with an angled bat (45 degrees as opposed to the routine 90), and finds a short point
terrific over so far. On a length outside off, forcing Finch to defend
maiden for Shami. India's best over so far. Full outside off, Finch strides forward and drives to mid-off. Found his length there, helped by a good field from Kohli/Dhoni
141 kph, Umesh is too full and as soon as it is, Warner goes over the infield. Full outside off, Warner gets under the length and lifts the ball comfortably over mid-off. Not great timing but enough
drags his length back right away. That's where he should have been off the first ball. Full on off, defended towards cover
a slower ball, drifts down leg, wayward line again, 118 kph, off the pad down to fine leg
good from Umesh. On a length around off, blocked back. Keep it there for the rest of the over, make Finch make the play
oh no, short and wide at 127 kph, Finch doesn't find his timing but finds cover with a slap
drifts down leg for a wide, 130 kph
hurries Finch for pace. A nice short ball down leg, Finch is late on his pull, gloves it down to fine leg
that raced away. 141 kph, full delivery on off, Finch wants to go over mid-off but the ball skews off the inside half through square leg.
Australia have respected that length, why move from there? Good length outside off, sliced towards backward point where Pandey dives to his left
poor delivery. Short on middle and leg, pulled away merrily through square leg. Too easy
146 kph, full around off, driven away towards Kohli at cover. India chasing the game already
139 kph, digs this in short on off, Warner think of pulling but bails out late.
a yorker to finish, 142 kph, pushed back to the bowler.
late movement. Full outside off, Finch goes chasing but luckily for him, doesn't catch up with it. Beaten on the edge
full outside off, defended into the cover region
a slower ball around off, defended into the cover region. Dug that in, sat up
good length around off, pushed away towards mid-on
guided down to the third man boundary. A slower ball outside off, Finch opens his bat face and guides the ball down to the third man boundary. Nicely played
full and straight, worked away to midwicket
a slower ball around off, driven to Kohli at cover who has an unnecessary throw at the bowler's end. Softening the ball
good length, around middle and off, pushed to Kohli again. No run there
a slower ball outside off, carved away to extra cover
short on middle and leg, a half pull to square leg. Well played, kept it down
a slower delivery on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
good length outside off, punched to cover from the crease.
that was poor. Short and wide from Umesh, chopped away to point. Pandey runs to his left and lets it go, Pandya runs to his right and lets it go. The ball goes through for four.
in the gap this time, short and wide outside off, powered through cover for four. Just a slap
on the pads, worked away to square leg this time
shortish outside off, pushed to mid-off for a quick single. Makes it easily
141 kph, on a length on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
nicely played. Full and wide outside off, Finch just leans on a drive and sends it into the gap at cover. Fantastic timing
flat and wide to start, pushed to cover from the crease
quick outside off, watchfully defended into the cover region
short outside off, driven towards cover. No turn.
runs at Axar this time, but the length is terrific, worked to midwicket from the crease
short outside off, sits up for Warner to push to long-off
short on middle and off, driven back to the bowler from the crease
wow, that was waaay down leg, wide. Dhoni saved four by moving quickly
short and wide outside off, nailed away to the sweeper cover
beautifully played. A shortish delivery outside off, not very pacey, Finch stands back and drills a drive through cover. No chance for the sweeper cover running around
a shortish delivery on the pads, nudged to midwicket
superbly hit, but mid-off does well. Good length outside off, pushed through cover, Umesh runs around to his right
133 kph, good length outside off, defended
smashed through cover again, a slower delivery. The cover fielder gets around this time
full outside off, stabbed into the cover region for one. Nice timing
quick outside off, darted in, driven to long-off
short on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for a run
quick outside off, still no turn, played towards point
poor delivery. Short and wide this time from Axar, Warner races back and nails his cut through point
on the pads, easily worked towards square leg
drifts on the pads again, Warner misses some runs, off the pad to short fine leg
full and straight, the ball moving in, driven back to the bowler
another poor delivery, starts it too straight, drifts down leg. Dhoni stops the ball but rolls over it as he falls over. Ouch
short and wide outside off, slashed to the deep point fielder
good length around off, outside-edged towards point
good length delivery outside off, nicely hit through point for one. Sweeper cover runs around
good length outside off, punched away to the sweeper cover for one
flat and straight again, nudged to midwicket
short outside off, defended watchfully. Tight lines these from Axar
the big reverse sweep. Flat on middle, Warner switches his stance, not his hands, finds third man
picks the length early and smashed. Short on middle, Warner picks the length early and nails his pull over midwicket. Six
that's Warner's fifty. Short and wide from Axar, Warner sits back and crashes a cut through point. Too easy
clipped to midwicket
good length outside off, driven towards cover for a tight run
on the pads, flicked away through midwicket for a couple more
a slower wide delivery outside off, cut away towards extra cover for a run
a slower ball outside off, driven to the sweeper cover
another slow straight delivery, driven away to cover
short and wide, slashed down to third man for one
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
shortish around off, pulled down to long-on
short down leg, off the pad down to short fine leg. Already going on the defensive in terms of flight
short outside off, pushed away to cover
lots of flight on that outside off, driven to long-off
good end, quick on leg, pushed back to the bowler and that will be drinks

overpitched on off stump, and that's a good stop from Umesh at long-off, sprinting hard and sliding to his left after Warner shows it the full face and sends it racing towards the boundary. Is it a clean save, or has his foot touched the rope? Replays indicate it's the latter. Still, a good effort from the fast bowler
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, chopped down towards short cover
full, a fair bit outside off stump this time. Warner eases it away towards deep point after shuffling across
full, a lot of width, Finch throws his hands at it and opens his bat face slightly to get the placement he desires, a fair distance to the left of Axar at sweeper cover
length ball outside off stump, presses forward to drive towards cover. Was in the air for a moment, but he was more or less in control of his shot
goes wide of the crease to angle a length ball towards off stump. Finch shows the full face and pushes it down the ground, past the diving bowler, and mid-off moves right to stop it
flat, angling down leg. Finch can't get bat on it as he tries to glance
back of a length, angling into the pads, tucked away to the left of short fine leg
tossed up on leg stump, and Warner gets down low, front leg planted just next to the line, to slog-sweep hard and flat over midwicket
quicker ball on middle and off, defended without too much footwork back to the bowler
goes back to a length ball that's only inches outside off stump and plays a controlled cut through cover point. Most batsmen would have played that off the front foot, into the covers
slows it down and gets some turn, rips in and hits the pad as he comes half-forward to defend. Clearly headed down leg, so not much of an appeal
flat, back of a length, goes back and works it off his pads through square leg
back of a length, turning in towards middle and off, defended to midwicket
length ball, goes on the back foot again, Axar gives him no room and he clips towards midwicket
a bit slower on off stump, gets forward to push down the ground, towards long-on, and Axar moves quickly to his left to intercept
down the track now, gets to the pitch of a slightly tossed-up off-stump ball and whips to long-on
length ball angled in towards off stump, slightly lower arm on this. Defended towards point

flat, and he goes back, plays the trajectory rather than the actual length, which isn't short enough to pull. Inside-edges it and drags it a short distance into the leg side. Could easily have played on there

down the track and that's six more. Not much Chahal can do about this. He looked to bowl it a little shorter, at his body, and not give him swinging room, and he just clears his front leg and swats it away over square midwicket
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length ball pitching on middle and turning away, makes room and slaps it away to sweeper cover, past Kohli, who moves to his left from extra-cover but doesn't get down in time to stop it
a tiny bit of width, and Warner makes a bit more room and slaps it away, off the back foot, through backward point
flat on the pads, clipped to midwicket
tossed up slower, lands on a good length on middle stump and turns into Warner, who gets forward to work it through square leg
flat length ball on off stump, goes back and across to work it to square leg
down the track to one bowled slightly slower on off stump. Doesn't get to the pitch, punches it back to the bowler

fired in flat, angling slightly down leg. Nowhere near short enough to pull - he was looking to turn it around the corner with a horizontal-ish bat - and he's hit on the pad. Not the loudest lbw appeal, he knew it was heading down leg
flat again, on the stumps, clipped down the ground to long-on
flat length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
angled in with a lower arm, pitches just back of a length. Goes back to punch to short cover
back of a length outside off, chopped down towards backward point

Finch misses, Dhoni misses, and that runs away for four byes. Looked to clear his front leg and launch that over mid-on, and the ball turned less than he expected. Went between bat and pad, and his back leg dragged itself out of the crease. The lack of turn has beaten Dhoni too - a missed stumping.
length ball on off stump, driven to short cover
flat length ball on middle stump, blocked back towards the bowler
on the pads, clipped quietly towards backward square leg
short, wide, slapped to deep point
flat length ball on leg stump - he saw Warner setting up to make himself room. Punched into the covers
now he expects Warner to make that premeditated movement and fires it down the leg side. Warner stays where he is and it's called wide
fired in flat again. Warner moves away from the stumps first, and then moves across to try and play a half-forward sweep. Misses. is hit on the pad, but it's going down leg
flat length ball on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket
a touch shorter outside off, chopped into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
steps out but goes too early. Chahal tosses it wide of off stump and he reaches out to stab it to backward point
length ball, closer to off stump, punched down the ground to long-off
tossed up on the pads, lands very full. Clipped to short fine leg
sees Finch looking to make room and slows it up a lot, floats it up gently. Doesn't have the pace to go over cover, so drags a sweep out to deep square leg instead, brings up fifty
flat, back of a length on leg stump, cramps Finch for room and he punches to short extra

again Finch makes a premeditated move away from leg stump. Slows it up gently and follows him outside leg. Not full enough for the drive so he looks to defend, and the ball turns past his outside edge and somehow misses leg stump.
flat, fired down leg. Looks to clip it round the corner, misses. Big appeal from Dhoni - maybe a bit of pad on the way through
flat and full on off stump, clipped through square leg

full on off stump, and Finch finally executes a shot he's been trying to play for a while. Unlike Chahal, Axar gives him some pace to work with, and he makes just a bit of room to loft that inside-out over cover
flat, back of a length, angling into middle stump. Makes a bit of room and punches it past the diving bowler to long-off
again, looks to cramp Warner by firing it flat onto his pads. Makes room and punches to long-off
flat, angling down leg, and it's a touch short too. Finch just needs a little bit of bat on this, and he manages it, just helps it away down to the fine leg boundary
tossed up outside off. Stretches out and plays a wristy flick-sweep through backward square leg
floats this down the leg side, and that's not a great ball with fine leg up. Sweeps it in the air, to the left of that fielder, and picks up four more
back of a length, pitching on off stump and turning away. Stops on Finch slightly as he goes on the back foot. Adjusts and whips it down to long-on
tossed up outside off. Gets on the front foot and clips to short fine leg, with the turn
back of a length, turning in towards off and middle. Chopped away into the cover-point region
flighted, and it's not the greatest ball. Lands right in Finch's slot outside off, gives him ample room to swing freely through the line and launch it cleanly over the long-off boundary
length ball outside off, opens his bat face and steers to backward point
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, pushes gently into the covers and calls his partner through for a single

back of a length, a bit of inward nip too as Finch walks across, looking to work it into the leg side. Misses, hit on the pad, but it's probably a touch high. Not much of an appeal as it runs away into the square-leg region for a leg bye
back of a length close to off stump, punched away to the right of Rahane at deep point. Bit of a misfield, the result of the batsmen putting pressure on him by pushing for two
length ball close to off stump, punched down the ground to long-off
slower length ball angling in towards off stump. Presses forward, lets it come on, and dabs into the backward point region
back of a length on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
flat, short, wide, slapped to the left of deep point
back of a length, sharp turn in from wide of off, punched into the covers
tossed up along that wide line again. Chases it with the attempted flat-bat drive and inside-edges into the ground and then towards the keeper. Again some turn from that line
shorter now, slapped away to deep point
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on

shot! That's a flat length ball angled into middle and leg, not much turn. Just gets down low, leaning backwards to make a bit more room, and helps it away with a flat bat to the left of short fine leg
length ball, looks to get forward and play down the ground, gets a little inside edge that rolls into the leg side
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
tossed up higher on off stump, driven hard but straight back to the bowler
on the pads, tucked away through backward square leg. Throw from Shami, who runs in from the boundary, hits the stumps on the full at the bowler's end, and deflects away for an overthrow
back of a length, turns in towards the pads, worked away through square leg
back of a length, angling into off stump, flat-batted down to long-off for one
ooh, that's a round-arm Malinga outswinger at the speed of a jalopy. Looks to punch into the covers, with no feet, and the ball beats his outside edge
this one's angling down leg and short fine leg dives right to stop a firm, standing sweep. Hardik the fielder
shortish outside off, slapped straight to backward point.

round-arm, very wide of off, and he takes a big step back and across and stabs it away to the right of the diving backward point to bring up his 14th ODI hundred. What a way to celebrate your 100th ODI.
back of a length on off stump, punched to extra-cover. Wanted the single to long-off, but Rohit dived left to intercept
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
down the track and Axar looks to cramp him by firing it at his pads. Flicks it round to short fine leg
length ball wide of off, a bit slower. Early into the flat-bat slap and he hits it to extra-cover
back of a length this time, and he doesn't quite get the room he wants. Again a flat-bat slap straight to extra-cover
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to flat-bat to long-off
flat, angling into the pads, clipped to square leg
slow, round-arm, short and wide. It's absolutely filthy but all he can do with it is slap it to deep point
slow again, angling down leg. Sweeps hard, and ends up hitting straight to short fine leg
fuller, on the pads, swept to the left of short fine leg but deep backward square leg is pretty fine too, just has to move a short distance to his right to stop it
back of a length outside off, slapped to extra-cover
again flat and short, slapped to the left of sweeper cover
shortish, wide of off, slapped to point

flat, full, angling into leg stump, and Warner's hit the roof! Just clears his front leg and swings his entire body through a mighty swipe over wide long-on. It was this close to clearing the roof and going out of the ground
back of a length outside off, slapped away through cover
flat length ball wide of off, and he goes on the back foot - most batsmen would have gone forward to that - and flat-bats it with immense power to beat sweeper cover diving futilely to his left
quicker ball, short and well wide of off stump. Jumps across to cut but can't connect

shortish, closer to off stump this time, and Warner puts it away clinically. Waits on it, and then chops it away at the perfect moment to place it unstoppably to the right of the overworked off-side sweeper
round-arm, full, angling into the pads. Finch clears his front leg and slogs it away powerfully over midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down the ground to long-on
full outside off, driven hard to extra-cover
tossed up full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length on off stump. Makes a bit of room and flat-bats down the ground to long-off

flat, shortish, angling into leg stump, and Jadhav has broken the partnership! The low release means there isn't too much bounce. Clears his front leg and looks to heave it over wide long-on, but it skids on and he hits it straighter than he'd like, and doesn't get the power he'd like, ends up hitting it straight to long-on
good length outside off, driven on the up to cover, stays on the back foot
on a length, the ball seaming back in, worked away to midwicket
a slower delivery outside off, pushed away towards cover. Another dot, three in a row
on the pads, Finch misses a flick, clips the pad en route to the keeper. Too leg side ish

looks to clobber it, such bad timing that mid-on takes a sitter. A slower ball outside off, Finch looks to drag the ball from well outside off, but it's right off the toe end, and straight to mid-on. So wide that it may have been a wide had Finch let that go
gets a gentle full toss on the pads and Smith works the ball through square leg. Great over from Umesh
slow, slingy arm down leg, a fine tickle down to fine leg for a run
shortish outside off, Head stays back and pushes the ball back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, driven away towards Kohli at cover, who stops it the ball with a dive to his right
short and wide outside off, chopped away to long-off
flat and straight, skids on, nudged to square leg
Smith backs away, then gets back inside the line, Jadhav follows him and concedes the wide
short outside off, punched to long-on from the crease

chipped into the hands of midwicket. Australia are falling apart quickly. On the pads from Umesh, Smith gets outside the line and just clips it into the hands of midwicket, where Kohli is lurking. This game turning around quickly again
nicely whipped away. Too straight from Umesh and Handscomb flicks away past midwicket for a couple. Played that along the ground
full and straight again, nudged down to fine leg for one
good length outside off, pushed back to the bowler. Tidy line
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
chipped back, just over the bowler. Short around leg, Head looks to turn this into the leg side but the ball stops on him and a thick leading edge just evades the bowler. One to mid-on
short outside off, flat, skiddy, driven to cover
this is shortish and wide, slashed away to the deep point fielder, a couple
quick on the pads, off the bat or the glove down the leg side. Hits Dhoni's gloves and ricochets away to fine leg
full and straight, properly defended
flat and quick, straight, punched to long-on
strays down leg for a leg side wide
short and wide again, cut to deep point for one
awful shot selection. A good length delivery outside off, Head tries to pull through midwicket, nowhere close to contact
and again. Short around off, looks to pull but the ball is too close to him, inside-edged into the pad
better. Full and wide outside off, driven through to the sweeper cover this time
good length on middle and leg, seams back in, defended into the off side
full and straight, pushed down to long-on
good length outside off, a thick inside edge into the body
flight on leg, driven to long-on for one
on the pads, whipped down to fine leg with ease
too full, on the pads, whipped through to deep midwicket
driven to Rohit at cover, who dives to his left
quick and straight, pushed back to the bowler
short on middle and off, pulled down to long-on. Another tidy over
short and very wide outside off, left alone, wide called
short and straight this time, Head punches down to long-on
shortish outside off, nicely punched to long-off with the spin. Not a great time for Australia to be slowing down
tossed up outside off, awkwardly played back towards the bowler who stops a run with a dive to his left
short, wide and cut away. Drops too short there does Chahal, Head rocks back and cuts past cover for four
overpitched and straight, driven back to the bowler. Too many dot balls
picks the fielder on the boundary. Short on middle and off, pulled to deep midwicket for a run
short and quick, pushed back. Head consuming far too many
another dot ball. Short and wide, tripe, slashed but finds point. The big shot not far away
cut to the deep point fielder
that's how it should be treated. A low full toss from Jadhav, Handscomb stays low and nails his slog sweep to the deep square leg boundary.
short and wide, so slow, Handscomb stays back and punches to the sweeper cover
another dot. Head is 16 off 27. Quick and straight, whipped to midwicket
full and straight, Handscomb shuffles right across, nudged to deep square leg
a slower cutter, on leg, driven to long-on. Fine defensive bowling
on the pads again, Handscomb clips behind square and saves a couple with a well-timed dive. Pulled that in just before he made contact with the boundary
full and straight again, whipped to midwicket. Off the inside half of the bat
good length outside off, the ball seaming back in, cut towards point. Just losing so much momentum here
a slower ball outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover for one. Just five off that over. Australia need a lot more
short on middle and leg, pulled down to fine leg. Just one
a short slow delivery outside off, Head misses a cut, another dot. He has effectively scored 17 runs off close to five overs, definitely not good enough
just short of third man. Full and wide outside off, Head looks to go over cover but can't make good enough contact. A thick outside edge lands in front of the fielder
just over midwicket. Full on leg, so badly timed that Kohli has enough time to jog around from long-on and cut it off. A fantastic dive from Kohli, saves two more. Placed well by Handscomb
a full slower delivery on middle, driven to long-on
a slog that trickles to midwicket. All the momentum of this innings has been sucked out. A short, slow ball outside off, Head badly times this to midwicket. He has to stay till the end and make up
one of the shots of the day. Superb. Full outside off, the ball seaming back in. Handscomb lifts a straight drive past the bowler, mid-off is wide. Sensational ball-striking
a low full toss, Handscomb walks right across and works it down to deep square leg
a short slow ball on middle and off, a whippy clip to deep square leg.
another slower ball, Handscomb shimmies down and flicks to midwicket for one.
drifts down leg, another wide

a big appeal, Head is not fussed about the appeal and races back for a couple as the ball trickles to Axar at third man. Good running. That was quite close, as Head missed a big heave and was struck in front of leg.
another slower ball outside off, awkwardly pulled towards midwicket
full and very wide outside off, Head stretched out but can't reach it, wide
picks that and nails it over midwicket. A short slow delivery on off, sits up for Head, who stays in the crease and clobbers it over the boundary. Well hit
a nice yorker, 132 kph, Head runs down and nudges that to deep midwicket
a short and wide legcutter, Handscomb finds deep point with a cut. Wonder if he could have done a lot more with that, place it wide, play it late
just short of Rahane, who over-runs it but recovers well. A slow bouncer on middle and off, Head reaches out and flat-bats a forehand behind square leg for two
full and very wide outside off, left alone, wide called
taken on the deep square leg boundary. Head toe-end his heave down to the square leg boundary, where Rahane runs to his right and makes a tough catch look relatively easy
oh gosh. A low full toss on the pads and somehow Handscomb fails to connect, off the bat or pad to square leg. Should have scored five more off that
a slow wide delivery outside off, driven to cover where Rohit lets it go through his feet, conceding an overthrow. An awkward bounce
short down leg, helped along down to fine leg, just one. Good fielding from Axar
drifts on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
a slower wide delivery outside off, under-edged to backward point. Just one more
full and straight, well bowled, Stoinis hurries into a defensive stroke
strays down leg, clipped down to fine leg for one. Should have allowed that to be a wide.
a half stop from Dhoni, saved two. Full down leg, clips the pad. Dhoni dives to his left and gets a glove on it
short outside off, cut to deep point. Stoinis sends Handscomb back late. A full throw to Dhoni would have had Handscomb
Rahane goes for the catch, the ball bounces in front of him and deflects off him into the boundary at the sweeper cover boundary
a slower ball outside off, Handscomb picks the variation, stays in his crease and goes weeeee over midwicket. Shot. Big hit

and bowled him off the next ball. Full and straight, seaming back in, Handscomb misses a big slog and the ball uproots off stump. Yikes. Just enough reverse swing for Shami. That's a fine cameo by a fine, young batsman
two dots to finish. Good comeback from Umesh. Shortish on off, Wade can't contact and is struck on the pad.
short outside off, smashed down to long-on for a run
a slower ball down leg, clipped down to deep fine leg for a couple. Good running.
terrific yorker on off, all Wade can do is chip the ball to cover and take the available single
a slower length delivery outside off, the legcutter, sits up for Stoinis to whack over midwicket. Short boundaries, big hit, six.
lovely batting from Stoinis. Full and straight from Shami, Stoinis flicks away over square leg with the angle of swing. A momentum-stealing over
shortish and wide, sliced to point for a run. Good finish that from Stoinis
back of a length, fourth-stump line. Looks for that dab to third man which he loves so much, but Smith moves quickly to his left from backward point and dives to deny him a single
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
fullish, angling into middle stump. Lets it reach right under his eyes and tucks it away to the right of fine leg
back of a length on off stump, angling in. Defended to midwicket
width, and a touch short too. Rahane slaps it away with immense power, and it flies away to the right of the diving Head at cover point
full on off stump, clipped to mid-on
back of a length, straightens on a fourth-stump line. Lets it come on and runs it down to third man
back of a length, close to off stump, gets back and across to defend into the covers

ooh, good ball, and well played in the end. A lovely length and some late outswing, and close enough to off stump to force Rahane to play. He defends very close to his body, with soft hands, and the edge dies safely and goes into the gap between slip and gully
another good length ball that leaves Rahane, this time he adjusts for it and defends towards gully with an open face
fullish on off stump, clipped to mid-on
shortish, doesn't quite bounce as much as he expects. He's into the pull early, can't really adjust. The ball hits him on the thigh pad and rolls into the leg side
full on middle stump, and Rahane puts it away easily, clipping it away through backward square leg, a long way from the man at fine leg
length ball on off stump, stops on Rahane slightly. Adjusts and blocks to mid-on with a straight bat
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to third man

length ball, a touch too straight, angling into middle and leg, clipped to the right of square leg and this time the man at fine leg is stationed squarer, more towards long leg, so Rohit only gets two runs for his shot
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, a hint of inward movement towards off stump. Lets it come on and pushes to the right of mid-on with a straight bat
short, wide, gets on his toes and flays it away to the right of cover point
back of a length, much closer to off stump this time. Lets it come on and defends with soft hands towards backward point
nice length, and he gets a bit of outswing too. Started it a bit wider to entice Rohit into a drive away from his body, but he just ignores it
shortish, some width again. Reaches out and stabs it to third man
back of a length close to off stump. Looks for the dabbed single to third man but the ball stops on him and hits the inside edge and ricochets towards his feet
length ball, fifth-stump line, a tiny bit of shape away. Rahane leaves it alone
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Lets it come on and tucks it towards square leg

short ball, sits up at just around stomach height outside off stump, and you don't bowl those to Rohit Sharma. Has all the time in the world to lean back and swivel through his hips to pull it over midwicket
back of a length close to off stump. Lets it come on and drops it into the point region with soft hands and calls Rahane through for a quick single
shortish, angling into Rahane's front hip. Can't put bat to ball as he tries to tuck it fine, ends up hitting his body and rolling towards the man at square leg
shortish, not too much width. Gets on his toes to punch to cover point
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to guide it down to third man
fullish, fairly wide of off. Gets a nice stride towards the ball and opens his bat face to adjust for the away movement, steers that to the left of backward point and Smith makes another diving stop
back of a length on off stump, defends it back to the bowler
oh man. That ball sneaks past the thigh pad as Rahane attempts a little glance towards fine leg, and it just misses off stump. That's how far across the stumps he moved in premeditation

bang! He can play these sorts of shots when he's in the mood, and the ball was right there for it. So much width, just back of a length, and he takes a step forward and slaps it up and over cover point
fuller now, confident stride forward to defend towards cover point
fullish outside off, and again Rahane flows forward, this time for a crisp drive to mid-off

ooh, risky shot. It's back of a length, angling into middle stump or thereabouts, and he gets a premeditated stride in, forward and across, looking for a scoop over short fine leg. Misses, and it hits his thigh pad. Too short for an lbw, so the appeal isn't particularly confident

oh man, he's really timing it today. It's shortish, and it's on a fourth-stump line. A pretty decent ball, but he just stays leg-side of it, deliberately, opens his bat face, and sends it racing away to the right of third man
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards backward point. He was looking for one but it went to the fielder too quickly for that

ooh. Maybe a bit of inward nip. Back of a length, and he was looking to work that from just outside off stump through square leg. The ball beats his inside edge and rolls towards third man off his back thigh
length ball, fourth-stump line, defended to short extra-cover
very full outside off, in the blockhole, jabbed towards mid-off
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, steered down to third man. It seemed to stop and keep slightly low, but he adjusted well, dipping slightly at the knees
shortish outside off, gets into that forward-press position and slaps it away to the right of third man
back of a length close to off stump, punched to mid-off
length ball angling in towards off stump, defended into the extra-cover region
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the on side
another short ball on off stump, another Rohit Sharma pull, another ball sails into the stands. Again, just that press forward, then he leans back and swats it away, just in front of square
back of a length, fifth-stump line, steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, and again Smith moves quickly to his left from backward point and denies Rahane that single to third man

now it's Rahane's turn to pull. Short ball just outside off stump, and he puts it away over straight midwicket. I think he was waiting for that length, and he pounced as soon as he spotted one slightly short
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and dabs into the point region
and he starts with a short, wide, rubbish ball that Rahane cracks away through point with a flashing square-cut
width again, fuller this time. Strides forward and drives to cover point
back of a length on off stump. Stops on Rahane slightly. Punched towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, angling into off and middle, whipped away through square leg
back of a length close to off stump. Lets it come on, angles his bat face just so, and the ball simply hits it and rolls down to third man
full, angling into off stump, shows the full face for a push down to long-on
fullish outside off, driven to deep point
back of a length, fourth-stump line, guided down to third man
shortish outside off, punched to deep point

on the fuller side of a good length, angling in towards off stump. Rohit shapes to drive, but the ball stops on him, and he checks his shot and defends towards mid-off. Looked like the cross-seam release
shortish, close to off stump. Again it stops a bit, and Rohit defends towards backward point
back of a length outside off, and Rahane punches crisply off the back foot. Once again, Smith dives from backward point to make a super stop, this time he goes to his right
length ball angling into off stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, shows the full face, looking for a push to long-on. Finch moves quickly to his left from midwicket to intercept
short ball outside off, stops on Rahane, and he waits and waits and waits some more before pulling to deep midwicket
tossed up full on middle and off, driven to long-off
goes back to a flat length ball on middle and off, defends to short extra
long-hop outside off, pulled to long-on. It didn't bounce as much as he expected - I think he was initially looking to pull that over midwicket
another short ball, this time Rahane goes deeper in his crease to pull. Hits it over midwicket and deep square leg moves to his left to stop it at the boundary
shortish outside off, chopped to deep point
tossed up close to off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length, turns in towards middle stump, goes back to whip to deep midwicket
fullish on off stump, a bit of drift away, defended into the covers
down the track, meets this flighted, wide-ish ball on the full, and drives to the left of long-off
short and wide, Rohit slaps it straight to cover point
quickish offbreak, a bit of turn and extra bounce towards leg stump. Defended towards midwicket, with the bottom hand coming off the handle
fuller now, looks for a clipped drive to long-on for one, and he gets his single, after the bowler moves to his right and gets a hand to the ball but fails to fully intercept it
flighted ball on off stump, driven to long-on
quickish, back of a length, hurries through and doesn't give Rahane enough time for a proper punch, ends up defending into the covers
fuller, on off stump, clipped to long-on
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs gently to the left of short third man
full outside off, chipped in the air, on the bounce, to the left of long-off
very full on middle and off, Rohit plays an inside-out jab and short extra-cover stops it with a dive
back of a length, turns in towards off stump. Rahane makes a bit of room and punches to long-off
ooh. Not short enough to cut and it skids on straight to beat the outside edge
down the track and Head shortens his length slightly. Rohit clips it down the ground, to the left of long-on
tossed up outside off, gets a nice stride forward to drive to long-off and bring up his third fifty in a row
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
goes back to a quick length ball on off stump, defends it back towards the bowler
dips onto a nice length on middle stump, stretches out and works it into the square leg region
flatter now, on middle and leg, flicked through square leg
googly - I'm not sure Rohit really picked this. Shaped for the drive to long-off, and then checked himself and defended back to the bowler, off the inside half of the bat

doesn't matter what this ball was, legbreak, googly, flipper or a new invention. Just sees a bit of flight outside off and he gets down on one knee, moving his front leg out of the way to give him some swinging room, and slog-sweeps high and hard over wide long-on
excellent follow-up. Flight and dip outside off, and Rohit, pressing forward to defend, is beaten by the legbreak
and another. Flighted ball on off stump, and Rohit brings up his fifty and the century opening stand with another monster slog-sweep over wide long-on
shortish, a bit of width, slapped to cover point
down the track comes Rahane this time, gets a bit too close to the pitch of a flat, middle-stumpish ball, and swipes it to deep midwicket, along the ground
length ball on off and middle, defended with the turn towards midwicket
back of a length, turns in towards middle and leg. Gets his legs out of the way and punches to long-on
manufactures a shorter length than it actually was by stepping deep in his crease, but can't punch this one past cover point
fuller now, clipped down to long-on
good length on middle and leg, nudged to Stoinis at midwicket

finds Finch at long-on and India lose their first. A good length delivery on leg, Rahane comes running down to hit Richardson over mid-off, but the ball skews off the inside half and goes straight to Finch. Did not want to hit that so wide.
good length outside off, dabbed down to backward point. A wild cheer as Kohli comes on strike
a nice short delivery to greet him. A bouncer on leg, Kohli ducks
full and straight, the ball seaming in, defended
a deft dab down to third man to get off the mark, he likes that shot
overpitched on off, jammed back
fantastic batting. Stoinis labours after it, puts in a dive but can't haul it in. Short outside off, plays the late cut very very late and gets it past short third man
full on off, a thick leading edged goes towards cover
driven nicely with the spin to long-on for a run
full on the pads again, driven to long-on

dropped! It's a half-chance, but Australia need to take those. Short outside off, the ball turning in, Kohli stays in his crease and nervously pokes at it, off the toe end to Head's left in his follow-through. He gets there but drops the chance.
full and straight, Kohli runs at the bowler and mis-times a drive to the sweeper cover
good length around off, nudged towards square leg
a very risky stroke, but he plays it quite well. Short outside off, Kohli chops it down to third man. Always the risk of chopping on too, like game 2 in Kolkata
nice line, good length around off, pushed to mid-on
good length outside off, punched nicely on the up to the deep fielder at cover
full and straight, defended back. Tidy over
short on middle, Rohit stays back and pushes his punch to long-off
short outside off, spins back in, Kohli goes back and cuts to cover
flight outside off, whipped to long-on for one
short and quick, shovelled off the inside half to midwicket
shot! Fantastic execution from Rohit. Runs down, gets to the pitch, gets underneath and goes through with a clean swing, right over the bowler's head. Lovely stroke
full outside off, nudged to midwicket
that bottom hand again. Full and straight, Kohli steps out and whips the ball through midwicket, between midwicket and mid-on. Just that bottom-hand power
and again, this time, drives to a deep-ish mid-on for one
on a length and straight, nudged to deep midwicket for a run
shortish outside off, opens the bat face and guides it down to third man for a run.
full on off and middle, driven to long-on

and Rohit is run-out! Steven Smith makes the run-out with a sensational dive. A short delivery outside off, Kohli guides the ball down to backward point, where Smith dives away to his left to stop the ball. He then has a throw at the batsman's end, where Rohit and Kohli are both vying to make the crease. Head is backing up at midwicket, picks up, and throws the ball back to the bowler, who takes off the bails. Unfortunate for Rohit, Kohli was run-out here when Rohit hit that double-hundred in 2013. That's how it goes
beaten on the outside edge is Pandya. Full and wide, drifts on to beat the outside edge.
short on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
full and straight, driven to long-on
just wide of cover. In the air, but safe. Full and wide from Head, drills a drive wide of cover. His timing does the rest, fantastic timing
nudged to long-on
yikes, watch out those snoozing in the high stands. Flight on off, Pandya gets underneath the delivery and nails his slog sweep waaaaaaay over wide long-on. Massive
good length outside off, chopped back to the bowler, didn't time that

happens again. Kohli has done it again, it was always going to happen and I think Coulter-Nile was playing for that. Good length outside off, the ball seaming back in, Kohli tries to dab this down to third man, but it takes the inside edge and hits the off stump. That's another error from Kohli, and the worst thing is he has repeated the mistake from Kolkata. It is a nice shot to a ball that is slightly wide and when the ball isn't seaming in.
good length on middle, the ball coming back in again, inside-edged into the body
good length outside off, dabbed down to third man
on the pads, whipped down to fine leg for one
full on off, driven to mid-on
flat on off, shovelled to midwicket from the crease
lots of flight outside off, driven away to the sweeper cover for one
flight outside off, loads of it, Pandya stays calm, guides this to short third man
bowled quicker and flatter on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide from Zampa, goes under the bat
flight outside off, driven to long-off. Stayed calm there did Pandya, didn't let his instinct take over
lovely whip past midwicket. Full and straight, Pandya clips the ball past the fielder. Cummins puts in a boundary-saving dive running around from deep square leg. Should have been three
full outside off, driven to mid-off. Staying slightly leg side of the ball, which is the right way to play the ball coming in
dabs this down to third man, an angled bat
full and straight, coming back in, whipped to deep backward square leg for a couple.
good length on the pads, nudged to deep square leg for one. Most of these deliveries will go in this area
full and straight from Coulter-Nile, pushed back to the bowler with a straight bat. Nice over
short and straight, the batsman made the error of thinking that flipper was a bad ball, pulled to long-on
looks to go over cover this time, but the ball drifts on, takes the inside half and makes its way to long-on
fine stop from Richardson at third man. Short and wide, Jadhav cuts that into the gap. The fielder saves three
clears midwicket. It's just slightly short outside off, Pandya stays in his crease and nails his whipped jab over midwicket. How did he get so much power behind that?
and again. Zampa bowls this wider outside off, tempting Pandya, who says I have a wide repertoire and drills a hard drive over cover. Keeps going and clears the boundary easily
flat end, towards off, dabbed towards point
good length on the pads, nudged down to fine leg for a run
full outside off, defended towards cover
on the pads, 146 kph, seams back in. Pandya gets to the ball late, and is clattered on the thigh pad, just under the actual protection.
good length outside off, carved towards backward point
full outside off, pushed away towards extra cover for one. Think he feels he is set
beauty. Full delivery outside off, the ball seams away or holds its line, beaten on the outside edge as Jadhav plays the line
full and wide outside off, Pandya leans into his drive for a run to the sweeper cover
good length outside off, tapped to backward point
131 kph, short on middle, sits up for Jadhav to merrily pull over midwicket for four. Easy as ... Poor ball
Smith stops a run again. Full and wide outside off, guided to backward point where Smith dives away to his left to save another run.
full outside off, Jadhav has a leaden-footed drive at that and gets one to midwicket
finely played. Good length outside off, a deft dab to third man. Pandya wants two and Jadhav doesn't. At least, it was a loud clear call
good length outside off, a dab down to third man for one
good length outside off, played to Smith at backward point
full around off, Jadhav comes down the pitch and shovels a flick to square leg for one
a short slow delivery outside off, Pandya tries to dab that down again but makes no connection. Cummins hurrying these two
drifts down leg this time. Bounces awkwardly in front of Wade, who half-stops it. Good from Jadhav to steal the bye

a thick under-edged past the keeper and into the boundary. Short and wide outside off, Jadhav is late on the ball but gets enough bat to beat the keeper. Finch runs around from third man but can't quite haul it in
full outside off, a thick outside edge towards Smith at point, a half-stop again, one run
full outside off, driven back to the bowler
shortish around off, Jadhav gets an under-edge on his pull towards square leg
good length outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man.
comes down the pitch, looking to hit that straight but the ball skews off the inside edge into the pad
that will be four. 131 kph, short on off, hammered through square leg with a terrific pull, played that early and fine enough for four behind square.
four more. Short and wide outside off, Jadhav nails his cut behind point for another boundary. Fantastic placement from Jadhav
full outside off, driven up to Warner at mid-off, good single from these two
full outside off, played down quietly towards point
fullish around off, the ball comes back in, defended back. Nice line
full around off, worked away to mid-on, the ball coming back in again
good length outside off, played down to point. Another dot. Fantastic bowling from Cummins
strays down the leg side, another wide, another extra
shortish and wide outside off, a calm dab down to third man for one
full outside off, defended back
full and straight, whipped away to deep square leg for one
good length outside off, skewed away off the outside half to deep point
lovely shot from Jadhav. Comes down to Stoinis, it's full and wide, and Jadhav goes through with the stroke. clean swing through the line, way over long-off. Superb hit from Jadhav
full outside off, defended back this time
on the pads this time and Jadhav flicks him away through square leg for one.

length ball angling in towards off stump, defended towards point and they sprint through for a quick single. That man Smith has dived in and flicked a direct hit at the keeper's end, but Pandya was well home by then
overpitched on leg stump, and Pandya just needs to place that. He does that nicely, flicks it away into the big gap to the left of long leg
slower ball outside off, and it beats Pandya, who opens his bat face and looks to guide it down to third man
back of a length close to off stump. Looks for the pushed single but extra-cover charges forward, towards the ball to deny him
back of a length outside off, dabbed to short third man - was maybe looking to beat him to his left
length ball on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
slowly tossed up on off stump, turning away. Jadhav is too early into his sweep and the ball hits his hip
goes back to a length ball turning from leg to off. Defends into the off side
back of a length on middle stump, pushed through flat. Clipped towards midwicket
flighty full-toss on off stump, driven straight to short extra-cover
he doesn't throw it up. It's flat and shortish outside off, and Jadhav slaps it to deep point
flat length ball on middle and leg, shows the full face to push down to long-on
ooh, not the right length. Back of a length, fourth-stump line. Bounces over his outside edge as he clears his front leg and tries to launch it over mid-on
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked off the hip to the left of fine leg
shuffles across to off stump and Richardson responds with a full ball on middle. Clipped to deep square leg
length ball on middle and off, driven to long-on

back of a length outside off, Jadhav shuffles forward even before the bowler releases, opens his bat face, and stabs to backward point. He's right on the edge of the circle, so they run a fairly comfortable single
fullish on off stump, and this time mid-off is right on the edge of the 30-yard circle, so they run a single despite Pandya driving straight to the man

miscued, and that's a massive wicket! That was not the right length for the big hit, Zampa dragged it fairly short and flat. Pitches on off stump, turns away further, and Pandya's attempted slog over mid-on skews off the outside half of the bat and settles in long-off's hands
shortish, close to off stump, goes back to chop it to the right of backward point and gets off the mark first ball
wide length ball, slapped to backward point
flatter, on off stump, gets on the front foot and dabs towards backward point

ooh, good ball. And they've gone to the third umpire for a stumping appeal! Goes back to a length ball and he's beaten trying to late-cut. A bit of extra bounce on that. He didn't move out of the crease, but momentarily moved his back foot forward - he dragged it rather than lift it, however, and he's pretty much safe
tossed up on off stump, gets down low to drag a slog-sweep along the ground to the left of deep square leg
sees Jadhav stepping out and bowls it short outside off. Hops to ride the bounce, and dabs towards backward point
down the track again, and this time he gets the length he wants. Just back of a length, and he plays a front-foot swipe into the gap between mid-on and midwicket
down the track again. This time he shortens his length and angles it into the body, cramping Jadhav for room. Drops it down into the pitch with soft hands, but no chance of a quick single
shuffles out of his crease again, and this time he gets the wide length ball, which he guides down to third man with an open bat face

shortish, angling into the body, and he tucks it off his hip into the square leg region. Loses his footing as he sets off for a single, and he stumbles onto the floor and loses his bat before finally managing to jog to the other end
length ball outside off, pushed towards extra-cover
goes back to a length ball on middle and off, and it straightens rather than turn away sharply. Jams his bat down to defend into the off side - it was very nearly back pad before bat
bad ball. Tosses it up and ends up bowling a knee-high full-toss. Clears his front leg and swats it away to the forward square leg boundary
tossed up outside off, driven with a wristy whip to sweeper cover
tossed up full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
again some flight, full outside off, driven in the air, on the bounce, to long-off
length ball on middle stump, presses forward and blocks back towards the bowler
back of a length outside off, flat-batted to mid-off
fullish outside off, and Pandey plays a checked drive - he almost seemed to pull out of the shot - and ends up getting a thick outside edge down to third man
there he goes again, striding out of his crease. Coulter-Nile digs it in short outside off, and he lets it come on and dabs to third man
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and jabs to the right of backward point
shot! Down the track again and now Coulter-Nile bowls it in his area, full and angling into off stump. Brings his wrists into play to whip it away to the right of midwicket and bring up his fifty
down the track comes Pandey, and Zampa is under pressure at the start of the over. Some flight, wide of off stump, and he gets underneath it and drives inside-out over cover

a touch short, angling down leg. Not short enough to pull. Looks to help it fine but can't put bat to ball. Only hits his upraised front pad, and rolls away for a leg bye towards fine leg. Belatedly, Smith as decided to review for lbw, but no way is that lbw. I haven't even seen the replays,and I know impact was outside leg stump and it was missing leg by a long way. I KNOW THIS. Pitching outside, impact outside, missing. Players need to be fined for reviews like this.
full on middle and leg, clipped to the left of short fine leg
flat, short, and he goes deep in his crease to whip-pull to deep backward square leg. Wasn't quite short enough for the full-blooded arms-extended pull
down the track and it's too flat and quick to get any elevation. Drags his slog along the ground to deep midwicket

down the track again, and this time Pandey puts it away. A difficult shot, because he fired it flat and full at his feet, and he had to quickly get his front leg out of the way to bring his bat down. He manages that, and whips it away hard, so hard it beats long-on's desperate dive to his right

bouncer, and Jadhav isn't in a great position for the hook. Needs to meet it above his right shoulder. Loops up in the air but falls safely in front of the man coming in from the long leg boundary. They manage to run two as well
length ball, and he uses his wrists to meet that on a fourth-stump line and whip it through backward square leg

wham! That's full on off stump, and he's cleared his front foot and simply flicked it over the midwicket boundary. What a shot that is! Almost a helicopter shot, without the full flourishing Dhoni finish
full on off stump again, jabbed down to long-on for one
walks across towards off stump and a step down the pitch as well. Clips the off-stump length ball to midwicket
down the track once more and Coulter-Nile sends down a clever slower short ball. Through his pull too soon and it hits him on the right hip
starts with a slower ball, full and just outside off. Looks to squeeze it square through point, but can't connect
full on off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off, another slower ball
back of a length angling into off stump, pushed to the right of extra-cover with a straight bat, another single
full outside off, stabbed to deep point
well bowled. Saw Jadhav shuffling across to off stump and sent down a yorker right by his toes.Jams his bat down to squeeze it out to long-on
full-toss, stump-high, on off stump. Makes a bit of room and dabs to the right of backward point, where Head makes a good diving stop

shortish, close to off stump, makes some room and slaps it away to the left of deep point. Placed it sufficiently wide of that fielder to pick up two. Coulter-Nile was the man in the deep - he moved a little late, because initially it looked like Handscomb would move right from backward point and stop it, but he didn't quite reach the ball
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed down to third man
short, wide, and cracked away. Such fast hands, and it screams away to the right of the diving backward point fielder

set himself up for a similar ball, going deep in his crease with his back foot. Cummins cramped him for room this time, angling a back-of-a-length ball in towards middle stump. Chops it down into the pitch
excellent bowling. This time Jadhav stepped out of his crease, and he nails a yorker right at his feet. Jams down to keep it out
out of his crease again and he gets a bit of inward nip with this back-of-a-length ball. Sneaks under the attempted horizontal-bat swat and hits his pad, high up
full-toss on off stump, flat-batted down to long-off
now Richardson nails a yorker, on middle and leg. Gets his feet out of the way and stabs it away into the point region

slower ball, full and wide, dragged down the ground to long-on. Wanted the big slog but it was too full to get any elevation. The throw at the bowler's end, from Warner, is fumbled by Richardson, and they sneak an overthrow

another slower ball, Jadhav goes after it, but he really doesn't manage to keep his shape. Had to fetch it from well outside off, and his bottom hand came off as he went through with the shot. Skewed off the outside half of his bat and Finch completes a simple catch at long-off

down the track, making himself a bit of room. Doesn't quite nail the yorker and it's a driveable full ball on off stump. Drilled down the ground powerfully, but long-off moves quickly to his right to ensure it doesn't go for four
full on middle and leg, clipped away through square leg and the batsmen hurry through for two
bowled him! Top of leg stump, and the Chinnaswamy goes utterly silent. Back of a length, not quite short enough to pull. Skids through, sneaks under, and the bails go flashing
length ball slanting across towards off stump. Pushes at it uncertainly, his feet aren't quite moving yet, and gets an outside edge down to third man
back of a length, angling down leg, and Dhoni tucks it away fine, too fine for the man at fine leg to stop. Don't know if Cummins was a little put off by Dhoni's initial movement across the stumps
down the track and he has an almighty heave across this short ball. Inside-edges past leg stump, and Wade throws himself to his left to stop it
short, rising ball. Too close to off stump to cut, and he's off his feet and he inside-edges down into the ground, not far from off stump
again a big step across his stumps. Cummins digs it in, just back of a length, angling into the body, and Dhoni swivels to pull to long leg
shortish, too close to off stump to get the kind of power he wants with the cut. Straight to backward point
slower ball wide of off stump, flat-batted hard but straight to extra-cover
slower ball, fullish outside off. Another huge slog from Dhoni, loses his shape, and nearly inside-edges into his off stump. Wade dives left to make sure it doesn't run away behind him
short outside off, and Dhoni's flat-batted it for six! Finally gets some leverage, some width, and he just slaps it away over the covers

bowled him! He's really not got to grips with Richardson's slower one, and he's dragged this on. Was on the cards, given how much he was hitting across these balls. Back of a length, closer to off stump this time. Goes for the big swipe over the leg side, only manages an inside-edge onto his stumps
slower short ball, angling down leg. Not the greatest of balls to bowl with fine leg inside the circle, but Shami only manages to swat it straight to that fielder
length ball on middle and off, only manages to push towards extra cover and pick up one
back of a length on middle stump. Moves away from leg stump to make room to swipe down to long-on
back of a length, angling across towards middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
shortish on leg stump, tucked away towards deep square leg
back of a length on leg stump. Looks to whip it against the angle, gets a leading edge that loops up and drops into no-man's land in front of deep square leg running in
sees him backing away from the stumps and sends down a yorker that doesn't miss leg stump by much, after Shami jabs at it in vain
length ball on off stump and Axar holes out. A good-looking straight bat loft down the ground, but he doesn't quite get enough on it to clear long-on
length ball outside off, slashed to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, swiped down to long-on
full on off stump, whipped in the air, on the bounce, to midwicket
shot. Waist-high full-toss on middle and leg, and he moves away from the stumps to make a bit of swinging room and club it away over midwicket. The umpire suggests it's just below waist high
back of a length outside off, Shami swings and misses, looking for the big drive over the covers
